items.sentence: The last time I saw Tom, he was still dating Mary.
I want to live in a place where locks don't exist.
My mother has straight hair and I have curly hair.
I'm going to change into more comfortable clothes.
I'm left-handed, and so I write with my left hand.
I'm looking forward to getting to know you better.
You aren't the only one here from Boston, are you?
You aren't really planning on doing that, are you?
Tom won't listen to anyone who disagrees with him.
Let's not do anything without discussing it first.
If I were you, I'd do the same thing Tom is doing.
I don't know whether that's what Tom wants or not.
Tom said that he thought that John was Mary's son.
I don't think that Tom knows Mary is a vegetarian.
I don't think that Tom knows why Mary left Boston.
I don't think Tom knows that Mary is a vegetarian.
I don't think that Tom knows that Mary is unhappy.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was worried.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was excited.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was nervous.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was jealous.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was thirsty.
Did you notice what kind of watch Tom was wearing?
When was the last time you had a home-cooked meal?
I know you probably didn't really want to do that.
I don't want the others to know my name isn't Tom.
Would you mind looking after my kids for a minute?
Tom told me he thinks Mary is prettier than Alice.
It should've been me instead of you that did that.
There's an old tower in the center of the village.
I'm anxious to know the results of the blood test.
This bicycle is old, but it's better than nothing.
Don't fail to call me as soon as you arrive there.
It'll be faster if we do it the way Tom suggested.
Nothing like that had ever happened to Tom before.
What color is the shirt that Tom is wearing today?
Tom isn't hiding from Mary. He's hiding from John.
I talked Tom into selling me one of his paintings.
Many cathedrals were built during the Middle Ages.
A lot of cathedrals were built in the Middle Ages.
Which sections of the newspaper interest you most?
All the salespeople are going on strike next week.
Tom likes to spend his free time with his friends.
Her parents decided that she would play the cello.
How do you know how to pronounce a name or a word?
Tom said Mary hopes John can take care of her dog.
Did you know you were going to be able to do that?
Did you know there's more than one way to do this?
It doesn't matter who you are. I can't let you in.
Tom burned both of the letters that Mary sent him.
